en-note.div: Is object calestenics the way to adaptable code?

li.div: Code Retreat, yet another set of Constraints, nothing special, just forces you to work in a different from usual way, to broaden your mind
Evening chat where Pedro was a flower
Mentioned his book 'Agile Technical Practices Distilled'
mentioned multiple times the amount of lines per function, and uses this as a way to indicate which team is better at writing maintainable code
Mentions training camp that teaches to write in this "real OO" way
"hmm, this sounds a lot like object calestenics"
Refactoring seems to bring code closer tot that "object calestenics ideal"
Some code smells match to some object calestenics rules
